intro: Euphlebium inaequale, commonly known as the unequal euphlebium, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Euphlebiaceae. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are often asymmetrical in structure. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in forest understories. Its reproductive structures include small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish in color. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Euphlebium inaequale is considered a botanical curiosity with limited ecological significance.
